abstract: Singer Tony Bennett, who has had passion for painting since he was eight years old, regularly creates watercolor landscapes in Central Park, despite constant interruptions by fans; has published two books of his art and has three paintings in Smithsonian's permanent collection.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Bennett’s identity as a painter is entwined with the park, which he says nourishes his creativity and is his antidote to urbanity.

headline.main: Tony Bennett Finds His Heart in Central Park
headline.print_headline: Finding His Heart in Central Park

snippet: Mr. Bennett’s identity as a painter is entwined with the park, which he says nourishes his creativity and is his antidote to urbanity.
